author: gantez
created_time: December 14, 2022, 07:10:38 AMLast edit: December 14, 2022, 08:57:30 AM by gantez
content: Messi is now close to grab the world cup glory adding to his name and trophy he have to himself like most of the greatest footballers that passed this place, the earth. Like Maradona in 1986 world cup and many other big player. Messi won't be happy if he will lose the second and last chance to add the world cup trophy in his name. He has the first chance in the finals in 2014 but Germany denied it.Is he going to fight against Moroccans or the French side but I know he is going to really fight for it because this is his very last chance to win the greatest of the football trophy. Image

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: I don't watch much soccer, or really any to be honest, but I have been paying a little bit of attention to the modern day GOAT talk between Cristiano Ronaldo & Lionel Messi.  My understanding is that if Lionel Messi wins this World Cup, he'll have a damned good argument at being the GOAT over Cristiano Ronaldo.  I'm sure it isn't that black and white, and no matter what happens there will always be doubters, but from my perspective I think Lionel Messi will be the GOAT (of modern soccer) if he is able to win this World Cup.  I'm hoping he can pull it off.  I like a good legacy.

comments.body: Messi deserves it as Argentina was stellar yesterday especially in the second half and thanks to him who scored a penalty and assisted Alvarez in the other two goals,he is a great player,he disorient the opponents and thus making room for the Argentinian attackers to show their skills and he even in most of the cases as I said provides great assists to the attackers.It is up to him now to bring for the second time the World Cup in Argentina as Maradona did in 1986 and nearly missed again in 1990 in the final.France is most likely going to be the opponent,a strong one but surely not as strong as this Argentinian side.

comments.author: dothebeats
comments.body: Dude is already a legend in football even if he doesn't get the trophy this world cup, but it will certainly be a nice addition to his legacy if he were to win it all to his name and to their team as well. Whichever team they face, for sure that team will do their best to not let Messi win, and at the same time bring pride and joy to their home country as well. We're lucky we've witnessed Messi go from a relatively unknown player up until his peak and we're enjoying it til now.

comments.author: pungopete468
comments.body: Messi is a renewed football player around the globe, and that alone is a dream that every player will be happy to achieve as a result of their passion and hard work. Although this recognition will really make an impact on the image and background of Messi, I firmly believe that his legacy is already established and will never be replaced or changed based on any awards. But, at the end of the day, having this award will surely add up to his many achievements which would not only make him happy but his fans as well.
